column4: DapperDrake, is the GNOME team working to reduce processor and RAM memory requirements?
is KDE better?  Ive never used it
it is slightly less memory hungry...
why did you tell me to 'dream on' ?
as to dreaming, link to follow...
so what window manager is both highly usable like gnome or kde and not memory hungry
XFCE4 for example, and there is now Xubuntu, a project to use it. Also, it is possible to configure KDE to be a lot less memory hungry.
but you cannot configure gnome to be less memory hungry?
a bit less, but not quite as much as KDE. GNOME developers are usually wealthy people with large amounts of RAM.
for KDE, have a look here: http://WWW.sabi.co.UK/Notes/linuxKDE.html#performance for memory reduction options.
also read this for minimizing memory usage at the kernel level: http://www.sabi.co.uk/Notes/anno05-4th.html#051008
KDE is quite flashy by default, to impress people, just like GNOME. The ''demo effect''.
i thought flashy and high-graphics UIs were memory hungry
yes, thats why one should disable all flashy effects in KDE, as the page I linked to says.
